meanings.definition: A gift or offering dedicated to God.
meanings.sent1: The people brought their corbans to the temple to show their devotion.
meanings.sent2: The priest accepted the corbans from the worshippers with gratitude.
meanings.sent3: The corbans were so plentiful that the temple overflowed with blessings.
meanings.sent4: Her heart was a corbans of love, offered freely to those in need.
meanings.sent5: The corbans gleamed with the purest intentions, a beacon of faith.

meanings.definition: A sacrifice or offering made to God.
meanings.sent1: During the ceremony, the community presented their corbans to the altar.
meanings.sent2: The ancient tradition required a corbans of the finest livestock.
meanings.sent3: The corbans, a humble gift, brought smiles to the faces of the priests.
meanings.sent4: His corbans of time and effort were a testament to his devotion.
meanings.sent5: The corbans symbolized the bond between the people and their Creator.

meanings.sent1: The sacred relics were considered corbans, set apart for divine purposes.
meanings.sent2: The family heirloom was passed down as a cherished corbans for generations.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child declared his favorite toy a corbans, off-limits to others.
meanings.sent4: The old oak tree stood tall, a living corbans in the midst of the forest.
meanings.sent5: The ancient manuscript was a corbans of wisdom, treasured by scholars.
